description.content: Personal website which is a portofolio of my professional life

about.intro: I am currently working at Linxo a french company that made a Personal Financial Management for B2C and B2B.
about.jobs: For job proposition contact me at jobs@guillaumeperrin.io.

experience.linxo1: I am currently working at Linxo in Aix-en-Provence, France.
experience.linxo2: I work in the Site Reliability Engineering team, that is responsible of the production infrastructure and the development tools. The team takes care of the CI/CD pipelines, and also give advices and solutions to allow developers to write good code and deliver them safely to production.
experience.linxo3: I also develop tools to help developers to test Linxo products, or critical components like handling of security module (HSM) or connections to banks.
experience.antidot1: This work take place at Antidot in Lambesc near Aix-en-Provence in France.
experience.antidot2: I worked in the Platform team which is responsible of search engine, indexation solution and back-office used to configure the solution.
experience.antidot3: I started working on the back-office software, and then worked on indexation solution too. I also take care of CI pipelines, packaging deployment and integration of opensource software and libraries in our products.
experience.ibm1: This internship took place at IBM in Montpellier, France, in a Client Center.
experience.ibm2: The main goal of this internship was to develop an automated testing tool for the GDPS Solution. GDPS is a product for mainframe.
experience.ibm3: During the internship, a website has been developed to create and execute test cases and tools on mainframe to get information and send commands to execute too.
experience.st1: This internship took place at ST Microelectronics in Grenoble, France.
experience.st2: The main goal of this internship was to develop an application which helps engineers to analyse testing data of the integrated circuits by processing and summarizing them. Engineers can have a global vision of test results and can therefore find the reason of failures easier.

projects.car1: This is a school project, made at the end of my second year at Ensimag. It has been made with two other students during 3 weeks.
projects.car2: This project was developed for a proof of concept and it will be used as a base for pratical works in school.
projects.car3: We use RC cars with a webcam, a Windows Tablet and an Arduino on them. Then, the tablet processes images from the webcam, and sends commands for steering and throttle to the Arduino which will control servomotors.
projects.car4: You can find the project's run on this page (in French).
projects.steeve1: This is a school project, made during my second year at IUT (two-years technical degree). It has been made with three other students during 6 months.
projects.steeve2: This was our first real experience with C++ and video game development which was harder than we expected.
projects.steeve3: The result of the development was a working application, on Windows.
projects.steeve4: If I had the opportunity to make this game again, I would certainly not do it the same way. In fact, we were really dependent on Visual Studio and on many libraries that made it very difficult to compile.
